comments:
When the server crashes during connection negotiation,
it propogates through the client as a null pointer exception:

$ svc --location=remote:svc:6060:stellation checkout org.eclipse.stellation.misc
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.apache.oro.text.perl.Perl5Util.match(Unknown Source)
        at
org.eclipse.stellation.comm.messaging.Connection.receiveIdentityMessage(Connection.java:91)
        at
org.eclipse.stellation.comm.messaging.Connection.<init>(Connection.java:64)
        at
org.eclipse.stellation.comm.messaging.Engine.openConnection(Engine.java:496)
        at
org.eclipse.stellation.repos.messaging.client.RemoteAccessPoint.<init>(RemoteAccessPoint.java:39)
        at
org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Connection.getAccessPoint(Connection.java:191)
        at org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Connection.open(Connection.java:107)
        at org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Checkout.command(Checkout.java:106)
        at org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Svc.command(Svc.java:81)
        at org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Svc.run(Svc.java:540)
        at org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Svc.main(Svc.java:333)

The client now notices the error when the server connection
drops, and correctly throws an IOException, rather than
a null pointer exception.
